title: Modular Medieval Houses
description: This tool allows for the quick creation of medieval houses by utilizing blueprints. Perfect for the creation of large towns in small periods of time. It features 19 meshes, that vary from doors to balconies and entire building wings.
longDescription:
UPDATE: Added 2 new textures for the roofs of the houses.

Video tutorial: https://youtu.be/GiBl56Tbl84
Support E-mail: udkap@outlook.com

This contains 3 types of building blueprints: a regular house, an extra wide house and a tower. For each of these the user is presented with a standard element, on which he can add auxiliary elements (such as wings, extensions, balconies, doors and chimneys) wia the Details panel of the blueprint. This enables the easy creation of a large variety of different houses.

Instead of unwrapped textures, the materials are made to a large degree with tiling textures and masks. This makes it easy for the user to use his or her own textures if the ones provided do not suit his or her needs.

Some materials have a parameter called "Age", which can be changed from the details panel of the building blueprint. This parameter controls a few material masks which blend textures of drainage, dirt and moss to create an aging effect.

If the users have any specific wishes I am ready to add some additional features (extra meshes, helper tools, interior options, ect).
technicalDetails:
Number of Blueprints: 3

Number of Meshes: 19

Vertex Count: 150 - 4500

Collision: Yes (custom for the more complex shapes, generated for the simpler ones)

LODs: 1 lod per mesh (5-85% vertex reduction)

Number of Materials and Material Instances: 9 materials, 5 instances

Number of Textures: ~45

Texture Size: 1024, 2048, 4096 (The mask textures are 2048-4096)


Props scaled to Epic skeleton: Yes

List of Blueprint Features: Positioning of Wings, Doors, Balconies, Chimneys; Material Ageing; Helpers;

Intended Platform: PC

Documentation Included: No
